General Notes:

BERTRADE de Montfort ([1155]-1227). Robert of Torigny records the marriage arranged by Henry II King of England in 1170 of "Hugoni comiti Cestriæ cognate suo" and "filiam comitis Ebroicensis cognatam suam ex parte patris sui". The Rotuli de Dominabus of 1185 records property "Beltesford et Hemmingebi et Dunintone" held by "Bertia comitissa, filia comitis de Evereros, uxor Hugonis comitis Cestrie". The Annals of Burton record the death in 1227 of "Bertrudis comitissa Cestriæ". The Annals of Burton record the death in 1227 of "Bertrudis comitissa Cestriæ".

m (1169) HUGH Earl of Chester, son of RANULF de Gernon Earl of Chester & his wife Maud of Gloucester (Kevelioc, co. Monmouth 1147-Leek, Staffordshire 30 Jun 1181, bur Chester, Abbey of St Werburgh).

[FMG/Medieval Lands]

--------------------------------------------------------

He [Hugh of Kevelioc" married, in 1169, Bertrade, then aged 14 (the King giving her away in marriage "because she was his own cousin "), daughter of Simon de Montfort, Count D'EVREUX by his 1st wife, Maud. He died at Leek, co. Stafford, 30 June 1181, aged about 34 and was buried at St. Werburg's, Chester. His widow died 1227, aged about 7I. [Complete Peerage III:167, XIV:170, (transcribed by Dave Utzinger)]

Note: CP VII Appendix D:716 states that Simon de Montfort only had one wife. His son, a previously unknown Simon, was married to the supposed 2nd wife, Amice de Beaumont as his only wife. See notes under Bertrade's father and brother (both named Simon). 1

Bertrade married Hugh of Chester 5th Earl of Chester, Vicomte d'Avranches, son of Ranulf de Gernon 4th Earl of Chester, Vicomte d'Avranches and Matilda FitzRobert, in 1169.1 2 3 4 (Hugh of Chester 5th Earl of Chester, Vicomte d'Avranches was born in 1147 in Kevelioc, Gwent, Wales, GB,3 4 died on 30 Jun 1181 in Leek, Staffordshire, ST13, GB 2 3 4 and was buried in St. Werburgh's Abbey [now Chester Cathedral], St. Werburgh Street, Chester, Cheshire, CH1, GB.)
